results_summary: The whey protein group showed a clinically meaningful improvement in functional walking capacity before surgery (+20.8 m), while the placebo group improved minimally (+1.2 m). Post-surgery recovery rates were similar between groups.
population_specificity: Colon cancer patients (n=48) awaiting elective surgery for nonmetastatic disease.
study_duration: 4 weeks before surgery and continued for 4 weeks after surgery.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether whey protein hydrolysate combined with carbohydrate during training sessions improves performance and recovery in elite cyclists compared to carbohydrate alone.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in performance or recovery markers between cyclists consuming whey protein-carbohydrate beverages and those consuming carbohydrate-only beverages, suggesting no added benefit from protein during exercise when adequate post-session recovery nutrition was provided.
population_specificity: Elite cyclists participating in a strenuous training camp.
effective_dosage: 14 g protein/h (as whey protein hydrolysate) combined with 69 g CHO/h during training sessions.
study_duration: 6 days (25-29 hours of cycling in total).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of whey protein supplementation on circulating lipid profiles (TG, TC, LDL-C, HDL-C) through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: Whey supplementation significantly reduced triglyceride (TG) levels by 0.11 mmol/l but had no significant effects on total cholesterol (TC), LDL-C, or HDL-C. Subgroup analysis showed TG reduction was not significant in participants with low BMI, low whey dose, or those undergoing exercise/energy restriction.
population_specificity: Participants in randomized controlled trials (specific demographics not detailed).
effective_dosage: Low supplemental whey dose mentioned (exact amount not specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether whey protein supplementation reduces circulating C-reactive protein (CRP) levels, a marker of inflammation, through a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found no significant overall reduction in CRP levels with whey protein supplementation, but subgroup analyses showed significant CRP reduction in trials with daily doses ≥20 g/day or baseline CRP ≥3 mg/L. High heterogeneity was observed across studies.
population_specificity: Participants in randomized controlled trials evaluating whey protein supplementation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if enteral whey protein supplementation is safe, well-tolerated, and effective in improving growth in infants with perinatal brain injury.
results_summary: Whey protein was well tolerated by most infants in the high-protein group, with no adverse events reported. Infants receiving high-protein supplementation maintained their weight z score, while those on a standard diet showed a significant decrease.
population_specificity: Infants with perinatal brain injury.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether whey protein hydrolysate (WPH) supplementation improves recovery from exercise-induced muscle damage (EIMD) in physically active females.
results_summary: WPH supplementation over 4 days improved flexibility, reactive strength index, and reduced creatine kinase levels compared to carbohydrate, suggesting benefits for EIMD recovery in females.
population_specificity: Twenty physically active females.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether whey protein hydrolysate intake before and after exercise sessions improves endurance performance and recovery in elite orienteers during a training camp.
results_summary: Whey protein hydrolysate improved performance in a 4-km run-test, reduced markers of muscle damage, and mitigated the decline in psychological sense of performance capacity compared to carbohydrate-only supplementation.
population_specificity: Elite orienteers (18 participants)
effective_dosage: 0.3 g/kg before exercise and 0.3 g/kg protein + 1 g/kg carbohydrate after exercise

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of whey protein supplementation on anabolic signaling and protein synthesis rates following concurrent resistance and endurance exercise.
results_summary: Whey protein ingestion post-exercise enhanced myofibrillar protein synthesis and attenuated markers of muscle catabolism compared to placebo, while mitochondrial protein synthesis remained unchanged. Anabolic signaling (Akt and mTOR phosphorylation) increased significantly with protein supplementation.
population_specificity: Eight healthy males
study_duration: Single bout of exercise with measurements taken at 1 and 4 hours post-exercise

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of whey protein (WP), with or without resistance exercise, on body weight and body composition in generally healthy adults.
results_summary: WP significantly decreased body weight and body fat when used as a calorie replacement (WPR) and increased lean body mass when combined with resistance exercise. WP showed more favorable effects compared to carbohydrates than other protein sources, though results were not statistically significant.
population_specificity: Generally healthy adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if whey protein hydrolysate with carbohydrate (WPH+CHO) differentially affected muscle protein turnover signaling compared to carbohydrate alone (CHO) during recovery from muscle-damaging exercise.
results_summary: The study found no differences in muscle force recovery or protein signaling (Akt-mTOR, FOXO pathways) between WPH+CHO and CHO groups, suggesting no added benefit of whey protein supplementation in this context. Remote tissue effects were observed in the non-exercised leg.
population_specificity: 24 young, healthy participants
study_duration: Supplements administered during recovery, with measurements up to 168 hours post-exercise

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether supplementation with a whey protein bar could improve oxidative status and endothelial function in ultra-marathon runners.
results_summary: The whey protein bar significantly reduced oxidative stress markers (thiobarbituric-acid reactive substances and protein carbonyls) and increased reduced glutathione, but did not affect total antioxidant activity or endothelial function as strongly as tomato juice.
population_specificity: Ultra-marathon runners (N=16 for whey protein bar group).
effective_dosage: Not specified (only mentions a 1:1 carbohydrate-to-protein ratio).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether gastric emptying after consuming a carbohydrate and whey protein supplement before sedation for gastroscopy was similar to overnight fasting conditions.
results_summary: The study found no significant difference in residual gastric volume between the intervention group (whey protein supplement) and the control group (overnight fasting), suggesting similar gastric emptying rates. No complications were reported during the procedures.
population_specificity: Adult patients (ages 18-65) with epigastric burning scheduled for elective gastroscopy.
effective_dosage: 200 mL of an oral nutritional supplement containing maltodextrin and whey protein, consumed 150-210 minutes before the procedure.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether whey protein supplementation affects the STARS signaling pathway, muscle hypertrophy, and strength in response to different types of resistance exercise.
results_summary: The study found no effect of whey protein supplementation on STARS signaling, muscle hypertrophy, or strength, regardless of exercise type (eccentric or concentric).
population_specificity: Individuals undergoing resistance exercise training (specific demographics not detailed in the abstract).
study_duration: Prolonged training duration (exact length not specified in the abstract).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of a cystine-rich whey protein supplement (Immunocal®) to enhance glutathione (GSH) synthesis in neurons and its therapeutic potential for mitigating oxidative damage in neurodegenerative diseases.
results_summary: The study suggests that Immunocal® may enhance de novo GSH synthesis in neurons, potentially offering neuroprotection against oxidative damage linked to neurodegenerative diseases. The review also highlights patents related to GSH modulation in neurodegeneration.
population_specificity: Neurons (in vitro or theoretical application to neurodegenerative disease patients, not explicitly specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of whey protein supplementation on intrahepatocellular lipids (IHCL), fasting plasma triglycerides, and other metabolic parameters in obese non-diabetic women.
results_summary: Whey protein supplementation significantly reduced IHCL by 20.8%, fasting triglycerides by 15%, and total cholesterol by 7.3%, while slightly increasing fat-free mass. No adverse effects on glucose tolerance, insulin sensitivity, or creatinine clearance were observed.
population_specificity: Obese non-diabetic women.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether pressurized whey protein supplementation could improve nutritional status and reduce inflammation in patients with cystic fibrosis.
results_summary: Pressurized whey supplementation improved nutritional status (assessed by BMI) in both children and adults with CF, reduced CRP levels in most patients with initially elevated levels, and showed a trend toward decreased IL-8 responses in adults. However, whole blood glutathione levels remained unchanged.
population_specificity: 27 patients with cystic fibrosis (9 children, 18 adults).
effective_dosage: 20 g/day for patients under 18 years, 40 g/day for older patients.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether White Kidney Bean Extract (WKBE) affects gut microbiota composition, gastrointestinal inflammation, symptoms, and stool habits, as well as its potential mechanism via alpha-amylase inhibition.
results_summary: WKBE supplementation altered gut microbiota composition (reduced Bacteroidetes, increased Firmicutes) but showed no significant differences post-intervention compared to control. It had no significant effects on GI inflammation, symptoms, stool habits, or alpha-amylase activity.
population_specificity: 20 healthy adults

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of varying quantities of whey protein on exercise-induced changes in body composition and metabolic syndrome indices in middle-aged overweight and obese adults.
results_summary: Whey protein supplementation did not significantly influence body composition or metabolic syndrome indices, though exercise training alone improved strength, VO2max, lean body mass, and reduced fat mass. No significant changes were observed in glucose tolerance, lipid profiles, or inflammatory markers due to whey protein.
population_specificity: Middle-aged overweight and obese adults (men and women, age 48 ± 7.9 years, BMI 30.0 ± 2.8 kg/m²).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the impact of a proprietary white kidney bean extract (Phase 2) on weight management in individuals with overweight and moderate obesity during a calorie-restricted diet.
results_summary: The study found that Phase 2 significantly reduced body weight, fat mass, BMI, and circumferences (waist, hip, and thigh) in a dose-dependent manner, with the high-dose group showing the most pronounced effects. The extract was deemed effective and safe for aiding weight and fat loss.
population_specificity: Subjects with overweight and moderate obesity
effective_dosage: 700 mg (low dose) or 1000 mg (high dose), three times daily before meals

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the bioactivity, phytochemistry, and subacute toxic effects of Morus alba (White Mulberry) ethanolic leaf extract from Brunei Darussalam in female mice.
results_summary: The study found that White Mulberry leaf extract contains abundant polyphenols, with chlorogenic acid as the primary compound. Subacute toxicity testing revealed mild hepatotoxicity at higher doses (500 and 1000 mg/kg), while the 125 mg/kg dose was safe with no adverse effects.
population_specificity: Female Institute of Cancer Research (ICR) mice.
study_duration: Subacute toxicity study duration not explicitly stated in the abstract.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the anti-TB efficacy of morusin, a flavone from White Mulberry, against various Mycobacterium tuberculosis strains, including drug-resistant ones.
results_summary: Morusin showed anti-TB activity with MIC values of 6.72 μg/ml for H37Ra, H37Rv, and RIF-resistant strains, and 13.45 μg/ml for INH-resistant and SM-resistant strains. The study suggests morusin could be a potential alternative or precursor for TB treatment but calls for further mechanistic and clinical studies.
population_specificity: Mycobacterium tuberculosis strains (H37Ra, H37Rv, and drug-resistant variants).
effective_dosage: MIC range of 53.83–0.21 μg/ml, with specific MICs of 6.72 μg/ml and 13.45 μg/ml for tested strains.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to develop hairy root cultures of white mulberry and assess the effect of multiple elicitor combinations on the production of bioactive stilbenes and benzofurans.
results_summary: The study found that co-treatment with 18 g/L CD, 3 mM H2O2, and 1 mM MgCl2 significantly enhanced the production and secretion of stilbenes (oxyresveratrol, resveratrol, 3'-prenylresveratrol) and benzofurans (moracin M, moracin C) in the culture medium, while mulberroside A was only detected in root tissue.
population_specificity: In vitro hairy root cultures of white mulberry (Morus alba).
effective_dosage: 18 g/L CD, 3 mM H2O2, 1 mM MgCl2.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the quality of white mulberry products (herbal teas and dietary supplements) by measuring DNJ content, (poly)phenols, and antioxidant activity, and to propose a new method for DNJ determination.
results_summary: The study found low quality in tested dietary supplements, with insufficient nutraceutical content to provide expected health benefits. It also proposed an alternative ATR-FTIR spectroscopy method for DNJ determination.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro or product-based analysis)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Morus alba L. (MAME) could mitigate iron-overload-induced oxidative stress and liver injury in mice.
results_summary: MAME treatment significantly reduced liver iron, serum ferritin, oxidative stress, and restored liver antioxidants, while also alleviating liver damage and fibrosis. The protective effects were linked to modulation of apoptosis-related proteins and MAPK signaling pathways.
population_specificity: Swiss albino mice with induced iron-overload.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a nutraceutical containing white mulberry, along with Ilex paraguariensis and chromium picolinate, could improve glycemic status in individuals with dysglycemia.
results_summary: The study found that the nutraceutical combination significantly reduced fasting plasma glucose, postprandial glucose, glycated hemoglobin, and improved insulin sensitivity. It also lowered total cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol, triglycerides, and high-sensitivity C-reactive protein compared to baseline and placebo.
population_specificity: Subjects with dysglycemia
effective_dosage: One tablet per day at breakfast (specific dosage of white mulberry not detailed)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the protective effects of white mulberry fruit extract on oxidative stress and inflammatory responses in LPS-stimulated RAW 264.7 macrophages.
results_summary: The study found that white mulberry fruit extract and its fractions exhibited strong antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects, including inhibition of ROS generation and reduction of NO production via downregulation of inducible NO synthase expression. Twenty chemical constituents were identified, supporting its potential as a natural antioxidant and anti-inflammatory agent.
population_specificity: RAW 264.7 macrophages (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a nutraceutical containing White Mulberry, along with Ilex paraguariensis and Chromium Picolinate, could improve glycemic control in patients with pre-diabetes.
results_summary: The study found that the nutraceutical combination significantly reduced fasting plasma glucose (-7.8%), HOMA-IR (-7.9%), and triglycerides (-8.3%), while improving insulin sensitivity (67% of patients returned to normal M values).
population_specificity: Patients with impaired fasting glucose (IFG) or impaired glucose tolerance (IGT) not taking other hypoglycemic compounds.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effect of 2-hydroxypropyl-β-cyclodextrin on the levels of phytostilbenes (mulberroside A, oxyresveratrol, and resveratrol) in Morus alba callus cultures.
results_summary: The study found that 2-hydroxypropyl-β-cyclodextrin acted as a retardant for stilbenoid hydrolysis, reducing mulberroside A deglycosylation and stabilizing oxyresveratrol. Extracellular oxyresveratrol levels increased significantly (>730-fold and >169-fold in free and immobilized callus cultures, respectively), but intracellular mulberroside A levels did not increase compared to the control.
population_specificity: Morus alba (White Mulberry) callus cultures (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the inhibitory effects of ethanol extract from White Mulberry Root-bark (WMR) against human carboxylesterase 2 (hCE2) and identify natural hCE2 inhibitors in this herbal.
results_summary: The ethanol extract of WMR showed potent inhibitory effects against hCE2, with three bioactive compounds (SD, KG, SC) identified as non-competitive inhibitors (Ki values 0.76μM–1.09μM). These compounds could serve as leads for developing hCE2 inhibitors to mitigate hCE2-mediated delayed-onset diarrhea.
population_specificity: Human liver microsomes (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to demonstrate the biological activity of white mulberry leaves in various human ailments and highlight its potential as a source of nutraceuticals and functional foods.
results_summary: The study found that white mulberry leaves contain significant bioactive compounds with antidiabetic, antibacterial, anticancer, cardiovascular, hypolipidemic, antioxidant, antiatherogenic, and anti-inflammatory effects. The abstract suggests these properties could support alternative prevention and treatment protocols for non-communicable diseases and malignancies.
population_specificity: Not specified (general human ailments)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effects of white noise on pain levels, weight gain, and vital signs (heart rate, respiratory rate, oxygen saturation) in preterm infants in NICUs.
results_summary: The meta-analysis found that white noise significantly reduced pain levels, heart rate, and respiratory rate while promoting weight gain in preterm infants, regardless of outcome timing, gestational age, or birth weight.
population_specificity: Preterm infants in neonatal intensive care units (NICUs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the adjuvant slimming effect of white Japanese mulberry extract in the dietetic treatment of obese or overweight patients.
results_summary: The study found that subjects receiving white Japanese mulberry extract lost significantly more weight (9 kg in 3 months) compared to the placebo group (3.2 kg). Additionally, blood glucose and insulin levels showed a more significant decline in the treatment group.
population_specificity: 46 overweight or obese individuals, including 20 women in the placebo subgroup.
effective_dosage: 2400 mg of white Japanese mulberry extract daily.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate White Mulberry foliage extract (MFE) as a growth promoter and treatment for Aeromonas hydrophila infection in African catfish.
results_summary: MFE at 5 and 7 g/kg DM improved red blood cells, albumin, and total protein in uninfected fish and enhanced hematological parameters in infected fish, with 7 g/kg DM reducing mortality. Growth was unaffected by MFE supplementation.
population_specificity: African catfish (Clarias gariepinus)
effective_dosage: 2, 5, or 7 g MFE/kg dry matter (DM) of diet

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of White Mulberry (Morus Alba extract) on liver enzymes, inflammation, oxidative stress, insulin metabolism, and lipid profiles in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).
results_summary: White Mulberry intake significantly improved HDL-cholesterol, insulin levels, and reduced malondialdehyde (MDA), but did not affect other metabolic profiles. The effects were statistically significant compared to placebo.
population_specificity: 60 patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the impact of white noise vibration insoles on the tactile threshold of the human foot, particularly in patients with diabetic foot.
results_summary: White noise vibration insoles lowered the tactile threshold in the second and fourth metatarsal areas, showing potential benefits for diabetic foot patients, but had inconsistent effects on the heel area. The intervention improved plantar tactile sensing ability, with better results in the forefoot than the hindfoot.
population_specificity: 8 participants with diabetic foot

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether white noise could reduce pain response, stabilize heart rate, and improve oxygen saturation in premature infants during heel puncture.
results_summary: The study found that premature infants exposed to white noise had significantly lower pain responses and heart rates, as well as higher oxygen saturation levels compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Premature infants admitted to a neonatal intensive care unit.
study_duration: During heel puncture procedure (exact duration not specified)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether white noise could reduce preprocedural anxiety and affect vital signs in older adults undergoing colonoscopy.
results_summary: The study found that white noise significantly reduced state anxiety and pulse rate in the experimental group compared to the control group, but no significant effects were observed on blood pressure or respiratory rate.
population_specificity: Older adults (N = 60) in a colonoscopy unit.
effective_dosage: 20 minutes of white noise via binaural headphones.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether white noise could be used to promote occupational safety and health in the workplace.
results_summary: The study found that white noise has potential applications in noise masking, therapy, cognitive functions, and sleep, which could enhance the work environment and meet occupational safety objectives. The results suggest white noise may be useful as an engineering and management control method in workplaces.
population_specificity: Workplace workers (general occupational setting)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the simultaneous effects of white noise on intrinsic attentional performance and extrinsic on-task behaviors in preschoolers with and without ADHD.
results_summary: White noise improved attention performance (e.g., better target differentiation, fewer omission errors) and reduced hyperactive behaviors in preschoolers with ADHD, but it was unhelpful and burdensome for typically developing preschoolers.
population_specificity: 104 preschoolers (52 with ADHD, 52 typically developing).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to systematically evaluate intervention strategies of white noise for alleviating procedural pain in newborns.
results_summary: The review found that white noise effectively reduced procedural pain in newborns, with optimal parameters including a duration of 1 min before to 3 min after procedures, volume at 45-55 dB, and music simulating intrauterine sounds. Differences in duration affected outcomes, but effects of volume, distance, or music type were not conclusively determined.
population_specificity: Newborns undergoing procedural pain.
effective_dosage: Volume controlled at 45-60 dB (55 dB optimal), distance at 10-60 cm.
study_duration: Varied from 5 min before to 5 min after procedures, with recommended duration of 1 min before to 3 min after.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the impact of white noise on gut microbiota, antioxidant activity, and immunity in mice compared to music and control conditions.
results_summary: White noise induced oxidative stress, decreased antioxidant enzyme activity, and reduced immune-related gene expression in mice. It also negatively altered gut microbiota composition, while music showed potential benefits.
population_specificity: Laboratory mice

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether white noise application could improve sleep duration and efficiency in premature infants.
results_summary: The study found that white noise application increased sleep duration by about two hours and improved sleep efficiency, while also reducing the number of awakenings and WASO (wake after sleep onset) values in premature infants.
population_specificity: Premature infants (28-37 weeks gestation) admitted to a neonatal intensive care unit.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of white noise on pain-related cortical response, pain scores, and behavioral and physiological parameters in neonates undergoing procedural pain.
results_summary: The study found no significant differences in pain scores, cortical oxygen saturation, or physiological parameters between neonates exposed to white noise and the control group, indicating no beneficial effects of white noise on procedural pain in neonates.
population_specificity: Neonates in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit (NICU) undergoing radial artery blood sampling.
effective_dosage: 50 dB, administered 2 minutes before the procedure and continued until 5 minutes after needle withdrawal.
study_duration: Approximately 7 minutes (2 minutes pre-procedure + 5 minutes post-procedure).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether white noise improves sleep in individuals experiencing sleep disturbances due to high environmental noise levels.
results_summary: The study found that white noise significantly improved sleep based on both subjective and objective measurements, particularly reducing wake after sleep onset (WASO) and sleep latency. There were also trends toward significance in reducing the number of awakenings and improving sleep efficiency.
population_specificity: Ten adult participants recruited from a New York City sleep clinic, all reporting sleep disturbances due to high environmental noise.
effective_dosage: Not specified (white noise device: Dohm Classic by Marpac, LLC).
study_duration: One week per phase (baseline, treatment, washout).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of a white noise app on sleep quality in critically ill patients in an ICU setting.
results_summary: The study found a significant improvement in sleep quality after using the white noise app across three consecutive days, with statistically significant results (P ≤ 0.005) compared to the control group. The intervention effectively reduced perceived noise levels and enhanced sleep quality.
population_specificity: Critically ill, conscious-oriented patients in a high dependency unit (HDU) with stable blood pressure and normal hearing acuity.
effective_dosage: White noise app administered twice daily for three consecutive days, using different masking sounds (white, pink, and brown noise).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate gender-dependent differences in anxiety-like responses to high-intensity white noise (HIWN) exposure in rats.
results_summary: Male rats exhibited higher anxiety-like responses to HIWN, including fewer entries into open areas of mazes, increased grooming, and more boluses, indicating gender-related differences in anxiety response to noise exposure.
population_specificity: Male and female Wistar rats.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of white noise and mothers' voice on sleep-wake patterns, cortisol levels, weight gain, heart rate, and oxygen saturation in premature infants.
results_summary: White noise significantly improved weight gain compared to mothers' voice and routine care. It also increased oxygen saturation during intervention but showed no significant effects on cortisol levels, heart rate, or overall sleep patterns.
population_specificity: Medically stable premature infants in a neonatal intensive care unit (NICU).
effective_dosage: 20 minutes at a time, three times a day, at 50-55 dB.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the immediate behavioral reactions of rats to sudden 90-dB white noise in a semi-natural environment and assess potential sex differences and the influence of estrogen receptor activation on these responses.
results_summary: White noise elicited fear-specific behaviors (hiding alone and huddling) and increased exploratory and ambulatory behaviors in rats, but only in the burrow zone farthest from the open area. Sex differences were minimal, and estrogen receptor agonists (EB and PPT) influenced motor activity and fleeing behavior, while DPN had no detectable effect on fear reactions.
population_specificity: Mixed-sex groups of rats in a semi-natural environment.
study_duration: 60 seconds before and 60 seconds after noise onset

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether white noise therapy could improve symptoms in children with ADHD through stochastic resonance.
results_summary: White noise therapy improved certain ADHD-affected tasks like speech recognition and reading/writing speed, but not all tasks, with logistical challenges remaining for implementation.
population_specificity: Children with ADHD

study_goal: To determine if white noise combined with glucose reduces procedural pain during retinopathy screening in preterm infants.
results_summary: White noise combined with glucose significantly reduced pain scores (PIPP) and heart rate while increasing blood oxygen saturation compared to control, white noise alone, or glucose alone groups. The combination was more effective than either intervention separately.
population_specificity: Preterm infants (gestational age 28-34 weeks, birth weight ≤2000g).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether white noise and music affect functional connectivity in neonates' EEG, specifically in theta and alpha frequency bands.
results_summary: The study found significant changes in functional connectivity in theta and alpha bands when comparing white noise to no intervention, but no difference between music and no intervention. White noise showed statistically significant effects compared to both music and no intervention.
population_specificity: Neonates ≥34 weeks' gestational age in the neonatal intensive care unit.
study_duration: 1 hour per intervention (white noise and music), separated by a 2-hour interval.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether white noise exposure induces maladaptive changes in the brain, potentially degrading neurological health and cognition, particularly in tinnitus patients.
results_summary: The study found that white noise exposure leads to cortical dedifferentiation and loss of inhibitory tone in the central auditory pathway, similar to age-related decline, suggesting it accelerates brain aging. The authors conclude that white noise should be avoided as a tinnitus treatment due to long-term harm.
population_specificity: Adults, particularly those with tinnitus or hearing loss.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate how acoustic white noise influences brain activity in the SH rat model of ADHD, focusing on neuronal activity and plasticity markers.
results_summary: Acoustic white noise improved cognitive performance in ADHD models, increased CaMKII expression in the TMN, and elevated ΔFosB expression in the nAc and DL-PFC, normalizing neuronal activity toward levels seen in non-ADHD rats.
population_specificity: Spontaneously hypertensive (SH) rats (ADHD model) and Wistar rats (control).
effective_dosage: Loud (≥70dBA) acoustic white noise (specific frequency/duration not detailed).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effectiveness of white noise in improving agitated behavior, mental status, and activities of daily living in older adults with dementia.
results_summary: White noise significantly improved agitated behavior in older adults with dementia, but no significant differences were observed in mental status or activities of daily living. The comparison group showed no changes in agitated behavior.
population_specificity: Older adults with dementia in six care centers in central and southern Taiwan.
effective_dosage: 20 minutes of white noise (ocean, rain, wind, and running water sounds) daily between 4 and 5 P.M.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of swinging and playing white noise on crying and sleeping durations in colicky babies.
results_summary: Playing white noise significantly reduced daily crying durations and increased sleeping durations compared to swinging in colicky babies. The effect was statistically significant (p < .05) and consistent across both study groups.
population_specificity: 40 1-month-old babies with gas pains who passed a hearing screening.
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention applied until babies stopped crying).
study_duration: 1 week for each intervention (white noise and swinging).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether auditory white noise reduces postural sway variability in young and older adults, particularly in the absence of vision.
results_summary: The study found that auditory white noise reduced postural sway variability in both young and older adults, even without vision, and improved nonlinear sway patterns in older adults to resemble those of younger adults.
population_specificity: Healthy young adults and adults over 65 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate differences in DPOAE suppression between acute and chronic tinnitus patients using contralateral white noise to explore potential mechanisms in tinnitus pathophysiology.
results_summary: Chronic tinnitus ears showed significantly lower DPOAE suppression amplitudes than acute tinnitus ears, with both groups exhibiting high prevalence of enhancement compared to controls. Non-recordable DPOAEs were more frequent in chronic tinnitus, suggesting changes in auditory function as tinnitus becomes chronic.
population_specificity: 18 participants with acute tinnitus, 40 with chronic tinnitus, and 17 controls, all with normal hearing (aged 34.7 ± 9.6 years).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of white noise on sleep quality in patients admitted to a coronary care unit (CCU).
results_summary: The study found that white noise at 50-60 dB prevented the decline in sleep quality observed in the control group, maintaining average sleep duration and reducing sleep disturbances. No significant changes in sleep metrics were observed in the experimental group, while the control group experienced worsened sleep.
population_specificity: Patients admitted to a coronary care unit (CCU).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate whether white noise could effectively reduce procedural pain during vaccination in premature infants.
results_summary: The study found that premature infants exposed to white noise had significantly lower pain levels (PIPP = 8.14 ± 3.14) compared to the control group (PIPP = 14.35 ± 2.59). Most infants in the white noise group experienced moderate pain (67.6%), while the control group predominantly had severe pain (82.5%).
population_specificity: Premature infants in a neonatal intensive care unit (NICU) in Turkey.
effective_dosage: White noise was played via MP3 players placed at the head of the infants' open crib for 1 minute before vaccination and continued until 1 minute after vaccination.
study_duration: The intervention lasted approximately 2 minutes (1 minute pre-vaccination and 1 minute post-vaccination).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if white noise affects cognitive performance differently in children with varying attention abilities.
results_summary: Moderate white noise worsened performance in super-attentive children, improved executive function in sub-attentive children, and had no effect on normal-attentive children. High noise levels showed little additional impact.
population_specificity: Children aged 8-10 years, categorized as super-attentive (N=25), normal-attentive (N=29), or sub-attentive (N=36).
effective_dosage: Three white noise levels (moderate and high, plus a non-noise control condition).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of white noise versus musical stimuli (Mozart, Romanza, Bach) on growth, brain neurotransmitters, and physiological parameters in Sparus aurata.
results_summary: White noise resulted in lower body weight compared to musical stimuli, with specific neurotransmitter differences (e.g., 5HIAA:5HT ratio higher in white noise than Romanza). No significant differences were observed in biometric measurements, protease activity, or fatty acid composition, but carbohydrase activity and some liver/fillet fatty acids varied.
population_specificity: Sparus aurata (fish), 20 specimens per group, initial weight 11.2 ± 0.02 g.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine how the movie "The White Noise" influenced audience beliefs and attitudes toward schizophrenia.
results_summary: The study found that the movie increased discrepancies between audience knowledge and expert opinion about schizophrenia, reinforced negative stereotypes, and increased social distance toward individuals with schizophrenia. The authors concluded that more emphasis on treatment, rehabilitation, and social support is needed to foster positive attitudes.
population_specificity: Audience members who viewed the movie "The White Noise."

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of individualized white noise audiotapes in reducing verbal agitation among severely demented nursing home residents.
results_summary: The study found a 23% reduction in verbal agitation with the use of individualized white noise audiotapes, despite the tapes being used in only 51% of observations. The authors highlighted the need for better staff compliance to improve treatment outcomes.
population_specificity: Severely demented nursing home residents

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of contralateral white noise on distortion product otoacoustic emissions (DPOAEs) in myasthenia gravis (MG) patients and how acetylcholinesterase (AChE) inhibitors influence this response.
results_summary: In MG patients, contralateral white noise initially did not significantly alter DPOAE amplitudes but caused a paradoxical slight increase. After AChE inhibitor administration, white noise induced a significant decrease in DPOAE amplitudes for middle frequencies, similar to the effect observed in normal controls. The findings suggest that AChE inhibitors partially restore the efferent auditory system's function in MG patients.
population_specificity: Twenty subjects affected by myasthenia gravis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the role of D2 receptors in dopamine turnover under noise stimulation and the potential therapeutic effects of piribedil on cochlear DA release.
results_summary: Noise stimulation decreased cochlear DA content and increased its metabolites (DOPAC and HVA) in vehicle-treated animals, while piribedil blocked this noise-induced DA turnover, suggesting D2 receptor involvement in cochlear DA regulation. Piribedil's action on D2 receptors may explain improvements in cochleo-vestibular disease symptoms.
population_specificity: Long-Evans rats
effective_dosage: Not specified (intraperitoneal injection of piribedil solution)
study_duration: One hour of noise exposure after one-hour pre-treatment

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the structural effects of continuous white noise combined with gentamicin on the spiral organ (cochlea) in very young guinea pigs.
results_summary: Gentamicin alone caused minimal structural changes, but when combined with white noise, it led to widespread outer hair cell damage in the cochlea, with variable cell losses and additional basal damage not seen with sound alone.
population_specificity: Very young guinea pigs
effective_dosage: 76 dB SPL white noise for 7 days; gentamicin at 80 mg/kg/day for 5 days

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effectiveness of white noise, VR, and basic BMTs in managing dental anxiety and improving behavior in children with ADHD.
results_summary: The white noise group showed significantly lower mean heart rates than the control group across all visits and had significantly lower VBRS scores during restorative visits, indicating improved behavior and reduced anxiety. No significant differences were found in FIS scores between groups.
population_specificity: 48 children diagnosed with ADHD.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining the sound of the mother's heartbeat with white noise could improve heart rate, weight gain, and sleep status in premature infants in the NICU.
results_summary: The study found that the intervention significantly reduced heart rate, improved behavioral status, increased weight gain, and enhanced milk intake in premature infants compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Premature infants admitted to the NICU.
study_duration: Intervention effects were measured at 10, 20 minutes, and 1 minute post-intervention, with weight and milk intake assessed up to 14 days.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of personalized music listening versus white noise (as a placebo) on cognitive function, mood, and activities of daily living in individuals with post-stroke cognitive impairment.
results_summary: The study found that white noise, used as a placebo, did not significantly improve cognitive function, neurological function, mood, or activities of daily living compared to personalized music listening. No adverse effects of white noise were reported.
population_specificity: 34 patients with post-stroke cognitive impairment (PSCI).
effective_dosage: Not specified (white noise was used as a placebo without detailed dosage information).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if vibrating foot orthoses (VFO) integrating white noise and stochastic resonance could enhance tactile sensation in diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN) patients.
results_summary: VFO significantly improved tactile sensation in DPN patients, with vibration perception threshold (VPT) values decreasing by 7-9% at key foot joints. Subgroups with mild-to-moderate DPN showed greater benefits, while no significant improvement was observed without VFO.
population_specificity: Sixty patients with mild-to-severe diabetic peripheral neuropathy (DPN).
effective_dosage: Stimulation at 90% of individuals' vibration perception threshold (VPT) level, using random 0-100 Hz square wave pulse signals with pseudorandom white noise.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how transcranial direct current stimulation (tDCS) affects speech perception in the presence of white noise, focusing on the roles of the left Inferior Frontal Gyrus (IFG) and left Superior Temporal Gyrus (STG).
results_summary: Anodal tDCS over the left STG improved speech perception in white noise regardless of stimulation order, while cathodal tDCS was effective only when applied after sham stimulation. No significant effects were observed for stimulation over the left IFG.
population_specificity: 48 participants (healthy adults)
effective_dosage: Signal-to-noise ratio of -10 dB for white noise
study_duration: Two stimulation sessions (one active, one sham) with a two-week follow-up

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the effects of white noise versus favorite music on pain sensitivity in individuals with fibromyalgia.
results_summary: Individuals with fibromyalgia were less sensitive to pressure pain while listening to favorite music compared to white noise, though they remained more sensitive than healthy controls. White noise did not show a significant advantage in reducing pain sensitivity.
population_specificity: Individuals with fibromyalgia and healthy controls.
